Reason: The 'memtable_heap_space_in_mb' configuration in the Cassandra software project is performance-sensitive because it directly impacts the memory consumption of the system. Changing the value of this configuration can significantly affect the system's performance by influencing the amount of memory available for storing data in memory tables. A higher value may lead to increased memory usage, potentially causing memory pressure and impacting overall system performance, while a lower value may result in more frequent disk I/O operations, affecting execution time.
